oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Henry L. Douglass, 1981 November 11, excerpt 04
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville doctor and urologist Henry L. Douglass, conducted on 11 November 1981 by Ophelia Paine as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. 1910-1935 Oral History Project. Douglass discusses working as an assistant to a doctor in downtown Nashville and living above the doctor's office on Eighth Avenue. He also discusses the Merchants Hotel on Broadway. The complete interview, as well an index, is available in the Special Collections Division.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Douglass, Henry L., 1891-1990--Interviews
